column4: Fonts are broken in my Ubuntu 10.10 machine.  mktextfm dies and Inkscape can see font names but not render them.  Google isn't helping.  Where should I look?
did you install custom fonts?
in terminal run fc-cache -vf
that should force your font cache to check for all new fonts
I installed the Microsoft TrueType font package when I first installed
Tried the command...
did you see a bunch of text in the terminal?  should have updated all the fonts on the system

Yes; I saw the text.  Status: Tex still broken.  Inkscape previews the fonts in the dropdown but won't let me pick any--always reverts to Bitstream Vera Sans and displays a little (!) next to it.  Ooo works.
hmm, that seems odd, perhaps re-install Inkscape, I would think if it is a font problem, it would be universal,
I can try that.  Odd that both Inkscape and Tex have troubles, but not Ooo...  Hmmmm
yes, that is odd, you didn't manually put any fonts in the font folder did you?
Nope.
the only problems I have seen with fonts issues, is when I put the fonts in the folder, and mess up permissions, that gets ugly.  I really think it is a inkscape issue.
you can try to move the inkscape folder, in your /home  to back it up, like cp .inkscape .inkscape.bak  and then re-open inkscape
That's a good idea.  I'll try that.
never mind that, it doesn't exist, let me track it down
ok, in the terminal with inkscape closed try this:  cp ~/.config/inkscape ~/.config/inkscape.bak
then open inkscape and see if it was a config problem
Cool; thanks
That fixed Inkscape; just have to get Tex fixed now.  But wife wants attention so that will have to wait. :)  Thanks ubuntu4shane!
no prob
